Dispute_Type: Rent calculation dispute over land value interpretation in lease agreement
Legal_Issue: Whether 'current land value' in the lease refers to fee simple estate or a 99-year leasehold interest on Indian reserve land
Governing_Law: Lease terms, principles of contractual interpretation, and applicable property law
Evidence_Assessment: Expert evidence and market data comparing on-reserve and off-reserve land values
Decision_Outcome: 'Current land value' reflects the actual value of the lots as 99-year leasehold interests, not fee simple; servicing costs must be deducted
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiffs to establish entitlement to fee simple valuation
Credibility_Factor: Court relied on expert evidence and objective market data
Legal_Rule: Rent is 6% of 'current land value' as defined by the actual value of the leased land subject to prescribed assumptions
Standard_of_Review: Correctness for questions of law, reasonableness for factual assessments
Procedural_Issue: Interpretation of lease terms and proper valuation methodology
Grounds_for_Claim: Plaintiffs sought higher rent based on fee simple valuation; defendants argued for leasehold-based valuation
Outcome_on_Merits: In favor of defendants; court adopted leasehold valuation with deductions
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court conducted full hearing with expert testimony and documentary evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Market comparisons, expert appraisals, lease provisions, jurisdictional constraints on reserve land
Legal_Framework: Contract law, Indian Act implications, property rights on reserves
Court_Result: Ruled that 'current land value' means value of 99-year leasehold interest with servicing costs deducted
Legal_Rule_Source: Lease agreement language and common law principles of interpretation
Defendant_Response: Argued that reserve land has lower market value due to jurisdictional and regulatory uncertainties
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, expert testimony, market analysis
Remedy_Requested: Recalculation of annual rent based on correct land valuation method
Outcome: Rent set at 6% of recalculated leasehold value after deducting servicing costs
Decision_Authority: Presiding judge of the trial court
Remedy_Sought: Adjustment of rent payments going forward based on proper valuation
Legal_Provision: Lease clause specifying rent as 6% of 'current land value'
Authority: Court with jurisdiction over claims involving Indigenous lands and contractual disputes
Claimant_Status: Plaintiffs are parties entitled to receive rent under the lease
Legal_Provision_Cited: Lease terms regarding 'current land value' and rent calculation
Applicable_Process: Civil litigation process including discovery, trial, and judicial decision
Jurisdiction: Musqueam Indian Reserve No. 2, British Columbia, Canada
Governing_Rule: Interpretation of 'current land value' based on actual market value of leasehold interest with specified adjustments
